document_data.name: Another Battle, Come the Morn
document_data.mainbody: '''''Another Battle, Come the Morn''''' was a drinking song popular with various [[mercenary|mercenaries]] across [[Faerûn]]. The composer was unknown.{{Cite dragon/272/The New Adventures of Volo: Quotations of the Realms|96}}
document_data.Excerpt:
Here are a few stanzas from the song:
:''The night so long and lonely-o''
:''Long time 'til dawn still to go''
:''And I wait all alone-ee-o''
:''Drink ye, drinky, gone below''
:''For wet courage inside to grow''
:''To face another sun and battle-o''
:''It may be the last I'll ever see''
:''Gods all now watch over me''
:''As this lonely song I sing''
:''For I would one day be a king''
:''…''
